venue.name: University of Maine Regional Learning Center

item.description:
Did you know that Maine was once the grain "bread basket" of our country?  Many whole grains are still produced in Maine at an ever-increasing rate.  Even small market farms and backyard gardeners are experimenting with producing things like wheat, rye, quinoa and more.  

But once you've grown them, how should you handle and prepare these Maine Whole Grains so that they support optimum human health and nutrition?  Join Kathy Savoie, MS, RD, from the UMaine Cooperative Extension to learn how to prepare whole grains like bulgar and quinoa and more.

$12 Fee covers materials and handouts.

6:30 start || 8:30 finish

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: Accessing the Nutrition of Maine Whole Grains
